captions.text:
What's up?
What's up?

Saw Les Mis, I take it?
I did.

And?
What didn't you like?

Well, considering that it started yesterday
and I'm just getting home, I'm gonna go with

'It's too f*cking long,' for starters.
I'm starting to think you have an attention

span problem.
I'm sorry if my attention span can only tolerate

17 Hugh Jackman songs before it gives up.
Dude, it could have been a lot longer, they

didn't even shoot the whole play.
'It could have been longer' is not a defense

against the criticism of 'It was too long.'
Okay, so what else didn't you like about it.

What about the speak-singing?
Speak-singing?

You know, how they don't say any lines of
dialogue.

Everything is sung, when they're speaking
Even if they're only saying hi.

It's a musical--
It's really f*cking stupid and it made me

really angry and it made me want to punch
them in the eye.

You are a good songwriter, that's for sure.
They turn every line of dialoge into a song.

It's freaking dumb.
That's what musicals do. That's what--

I need some milk my cereal is dry, could you
pass the milk-

You don't have any cereal
-to me.

What else didn't you like?
Alright, well, what's Russell Crowe doing

in this movie, and why does he sing like he
has to poop?

Come on, he's not that bad.
No, he's terrible. Another problem, not enough

sex.
This movie has a sex scene!

Yeah, with Anne Hatheway.
Right.

Listen, I only go to see Anne Hatheway movies
for two reasons: to see her naked.

That's not--
Boobies, I need those boobies.

Very mature.
When I go to the movies.

I don't even know why I bother talking with
you about movies because you--

Boobies.
Are you done?

Boobies. Okay, I'm done now.
Why don't we talk about some of the--

What about the riot in the streets?
What about the riot in the streets?

Why does it have to feel so small?
What do you mean 'small?'

The movie makes you feel like it's some sort
of historical trigger event, but it's just

a bunch of teenagers that had too much beer
hiding out behind some chairs in an alley.

Why don't we talk about some of the positive
qualities of the movie--

There are none! There are none. This conversation
is over.

You can't just end a conversation because
you--

Les Mis, Les Mis, the movie all in song.
Les Mis, Les Mis, it's f*cking 5 hours long.

title: Conversations With Myself About Movies - Les Miserables

comments.author: SockBadger 24601

comments.text:
Okay, so a lot of people have been hating on Les Miserables. It is a good 
musical, as the original play. All of those who say it's too long, read the 
book. Now imagine a twelve-year-old sitting through the entire thing, I 
think I have a longer attention span then some of the adults here. I will 
watch any musical, and I have watched a lot. I don't think that the movie 
was that great, but it is a good way to be introduced to the play. Also, 
what about the people who like to listen to the soundtrack? I find that it 
is a good thing on long car trips to listen to, and if it's all in song, 
then you don't have to improvise between the songs. Overall, I love this 
musical, and I think that some people need to think more about other 
people's feelings.﻿

That's because Les Mis is a "sung-through" musical. That's just the way the 
musical was written.
This movie was shit though. It had great production quality and not much 
else. They butchered the musical, and then let Russell Crowe defecate on 
its grave. The casting was terrible and no one sang well (except for Colm's 
cameo as the priest). The turned one of my favourite musicals into just the 
worst thing ever, this is one musical I think they should have just kept in 
the theatre and should definitely not have been shoved violently into the 
cinema.

having jokes - you know what you're in for when you pay to see it (or not

also unreasonable because no-one talks like Quentin Tarentino's characters 
do in real life either. I personally didn't like Les Mis, but criticise it 
properly.﻿

comments.author: ClintDecker148

comments.text:
Les Miserables is one of those stories that the vast majority people "like" 
because their told to like it if they want to seem "artistic."  Don't get 
me wrong, if you really do like the story, for your own selfish reasons, 
that's GREAT!  I fully appreciate people who like what's popular (even if I 
think that it sucks) but only if they like it and could just as easily have 
disliked it.
I hated the never-ending singing.  A good musical has musical numbers, but 
it also has actual, natural dialogue.  When they're ALWAYS singing, you get 
notes that make my musically-trained ears cringe with actual, *literal* 
pain (seriously, I'm not exaggerating this, listening to children sing in 
elementary school programs could be a form of torture to me).  Watching the 
EWW about this movie is quite painful.﻿
